Mathematica algorithm: Primary Triangle Shirkin

  • Defines the shirkin, an upward-facing equilateral triangle with sides in red, green, and blue, and positions its lower right vertex at the Origin in Cartesian 2-space.
  • Defines an arbitrary trajectory for the shirkin.
  • Causes the shirkin's vertex, the one initially found at the Origin, to follow the trajectory
  • as the shirkin also rotates about that vertex.

Additional details are provided in the code, which can be viewed here as html, or downloaded here as a Wolfram Mathematica notebook. Or, click any image to view it at full size.

Mathematica algorithm: Primary Triangle Shirkin

  • Defines the shirkin, an upward-facing equilateral triangle with sides in red, green, and blue, and positions its lower right vertex at the Origin in Cartesian 2-space.
  • Defines an arbitrary trajectory for the shirkin.
  • Causes the shirkin's vertex, the one initially found at the Origin, to follow the trajectory
  • as the shirkin also rotates about that vertex.
